mva2.adapter

Class MultiViewAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • <any>
      • mva2.adapter.MultiViewAdapter

  • public class MultiViewAdapter
extends <any>
    MultiViewAdapter lets you write complex RecyclerView adapters easily.

    MultiViewAdapter consists of Sections and ItemBinders. Both are modular and composable meaning that they can be used in any adapter and you can use as many of them inside a single adapter.

    Apart from this MultiViewAdapter has lot of other features like,

    • Selection
    • Expansion (Item level)
    • Expansion (Section level)
    • Decoration

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiViewAdapter

        public MultiViewAdapter()
        No-arg constructor for MultiViewAdapter. Initializes the MultiViewAdapter class.

    • Method Detail

      • addSection

        public void addSection(Section section)
        Add a section to this adapter. You can add any number of section to the adapter. If null is being set, then this method returns silently. If the section was already added to a parent, and you are adding it again, then IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        section - Section to be added to this adapter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the section already has a parent.

      • clearAllSelections

        public void clearAllSelections()
        Clears all the selected items inside the adapter.

      • collapseAllItems

        public void collapseAllItems()
        Collapses all the items inside the adapter.

      • collapseAllSections

        public void collapseAllSections()
        Collapses all the sections inside the adapter.

      • getItemDecoration

        public RecyclerView.ItemDecoration getItemDecoration()
        If you would like to use the decoration feature of the adapter, use this method to get ItemDecoration and add it to your recyclerview.

        Usage : recyclerView.addItemDecoration(adapter.getItemDecoration());

        Returns:
        The ItemDecoration for this adapter

      • getItemTouchHelper

        public ItemTouchHelper getItemTouchHelper()
        Get the ItemTouchHelper which resolves the swipe and drag gestures for the adapter's individual ItemBinder.
        Returns:
        ItemTouchHelper which needs to be attached with RecyclerView

      • getPositionType

        public int getPositionType(RecyclerView parent,
                           int adapterPosition)
        Returns the positionType of the item inside the layout manager.

        What is positionType? Position type lets you know the edges for the item. For example, inside LinearLayoutManager, item 0 will be at top edge, left edge and right edge. Inside GridLayoutManager, item 0 will be at top edge and left edge. This information can be retrieved with the help of Decorator. Ex : Decorator.isItemOnLeftEdge(int) etc.,

        By knowing this information you can draw the decorations creatively.

        Parameters:
        parent - RecyclerView where this adapter is attached.
        adapterPosition - Position of the item inside the adapter.
        Returns:
        PositionType for the adapterPosition

      • getSectionPositionType

        public SectionPositionType getSectionPositionType(int adapterPosition)
        Returns the SectionPositionType for the giver adapter position.

        SectionPositionType lets you know whether the Section is at the TOP, MIDDLE or BOTTOM of the adapter. By knowing this information you can draw the decorations creatively.

        Parameters:
        adapterPosition - Position of the item inside the adapter.
        Returns:
        SectionPositionType for the adapterPosition

      • getSpanSizeLookup

        public GridLayoutManager.SpanSizeLookup getSpanSizeLookup()
        Return the span size lookup used by this adapter. Make sure to set this SpanSizeLookup to your grid layout manager.
        Returns:
        Span size lookup used in this adapter

      • registerItemBinders

        public void registerItemBinders(ItemBinder... itemBinders)
        Register an ItemBinder to the adapter.

        Each ItemBinder can create and bind ViewHolders for a model. If no ItemBinders are registered with adapter, IllegalStateException will be thrown.

      • removeAllSections

        public void removeAllSections()
        Remove all the sections added to the adapter

      • setExpansionMode

        public void setExpansionMode(Mode expansionMode)
        Set the expansion mode for this adapter. This will be used by all the section unless the section has its own expansion mode.
        Parameters:
        expansionMode - Mode to be set as expansion mode

      • setInfiniteLoadingHelper

        public void setInfiniteLoadingHelper(InfiniteLoadingHelper infiniteLoadingHelper)
        By setting an infiniteLoadingHelper, you can add infinite scrolling feature to the adapter.

        Usage : InfiniteLoadingHelper helper = new InfiniteLoadingHelper(recyclerView, R.layout.item_infinite_loader);
        adapter.setInfiniteLoadingHelper(helper);

        Parameters:
        infiniteLoadingHelper - Helper object to be set
        See Also:
        InfiniteLoadingHelper

      • setSectionExpansionMode

        public void setSectionExpansionMode(Mode sectionExpansionMode)
        Set the section expansion mode for this adapter. This will be used by all the section unless the section has its own section expansion mode.
        Parameters:
        sectionExpansionMode - Mode to be set as section expansion mode

      • setSelectionMode

        public void setSelectionMode(Mode selectionMode)
        Set the selection mode for this adapter. This will be used by all the section unless the section has its own selection mode.
        Parameters:
        selectionMode - Mode to be set as selection mode

      • setSpanCount

        public void setSpanCount(int spanCount)
        Set the span count for the adapter. This will be used for all the section unless the section has its own span count.
        Parameters:
        spanCount - Span count to be set

      • startActionMode

        public void startActionMode()
        Helper method to set the adapter is in contextual action mode.
        See Also:
        To get the state of action mode

      • stopActionMode

        public void stopActionMode()
        Helper method to set the adapter has exited contextual action mode.
        See Also:
        To get the state of action mode

      • unRegisterAllItemBinders

        public void unRegisterAllItemBinders()
        Removes all the ItemBinders which were registered to this adapter. Make sure that new ItemBinders are registered to this adapter.
